job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
     * Database: PostgreSQL
     * Cloud: GCP
     * Version Control: Git
     * We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!

   How will you make an impact?
     * Our customers need to understand what happened across their bank accounts in the past as well as how balances evolve in the future. We have our first categorization & forecasting models for this. You'll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate:
          + Define success metrics for our models
          + Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
          + Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
          + Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
          + Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team (you'll meet them during the interviews!)
          + Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
     * Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
job_details.full_text:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer

* Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
     * Database: PostgreSQL
     * Cloud: GCP
     * Version Control: Git
     * We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!

   How will you make an impact?
     * Our customers need to understand what happened across their bank accounts in the past as well as how balances evolve in the future. We have our first categorization & forecasting models for this. You'll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate:
          + Define success metrics for our models
          + Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
          + Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
          + Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
          + Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team (you'll meet them during the interviews!)
          + Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
     * Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things

profile_classification.rationale: The role emphasizes building and evaluating forecasting and LLM models, defining success metrics, and productionizing them through internal tooling and monitoring infrastructure. While LLMs are mentioned, the core focus appears to be on predictive modeling and MLOps for these models, aligning with the ML Engineer profile.

phrases.phrase: Our customers need to understand what happened across their bank accounts in the past as well as how balances evolve in the future.
phrases.justification: This phrase describes the business problem the models are intended to solve, indicating an understanding of customer needs and business context.

phrases.phrase: Define success metrics for our models
phrases.justification: Defining success metrics requires understanding how the models contribute to business goals and customer value.

phrases.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
phrases.justification: This highlights the need to understand business needs and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure technical solutions align with strategic goals.

phrases.phrase: Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team
phrases.justification: This directly refers to the construction and maintenance of data infrastructure, a core component of data engineering.
Python is a common language for data engineering tasks, and BigQuery is a data warehousing service, both relevant to building data infrastructure.

phrases.phrase: Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
phrases.justification: This is a direct mention of creating and evaluating predictive models (forecasting) and generative models (LLM), which is the core of the modeling task.

phrases.phrase: We have our first categorization & forecasting models for this.
phrases.justification: Indicates existing work in predictive modeling (categorization and forecasting) and the need to build upon it.

phrases.phrase: Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
phrases.justification: This involves developing software tools to integrate and adapt models, which falls under software development for AI applications.

phrases.phrase: Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team
phrases.justification: While also data engineering, building infrastructure often involves software development principles for robustness and scalability.

phrases.phrase: Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
phrases.justification: This describes setting up systems for monitoring model performance in production and taking action, which is a key aspect of MLOps.

phrases.phrase: We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!
phrases.justification: This implies an ongoing process of improvement and deployment, characteristic of MLOps practices.

phrases.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
phrases.justification: This directly mentions collaboration with various stakeholders and the need to communicate effectively to guide technical direction.

phrases.phrase: We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!
phrases.justification: This indicates a dynamic environment where continuous learning and adaptation to new technologies are expected.

phrases.phrase: Define success metrics for our models
phrases.justification: Defining metrics requires analytical thinking and problem-solving to align technical outputs with business objectives.

phrases.phrase: Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
phrases.justification: This involves problem-solving to select and tune models that achieve specific business outcomes.

phrases.phrase: Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
phrases.justification: Developing custom tooling implies a pragmatic approach to solving specific customer needs.

phrases.phrase: You'll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate:
phrases.justification: Being the first data hire with a broad mandate suggests a need for initiative, ownership, and driving innovation in the data space.

phrases.phrase: Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
phrases.justification: This encourages proactive exploration and adoption of new technologies, demonstrating innovation and ownership.
